segment.source: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies (Windows 10)
segment.target: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create and maintain AppLocker policies by using a reference computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create and maintain AppLocker policies by using a reference computer.

segment.source: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies
segment.target: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create and maintain AppLocker policies by using a reference computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the steps to create and maintain AppLocker policies by using a reference computer.

segment.source: Background and prerequisites
segment.target: Background and prerequisites

segment.source: An AppLocker reference device is a baseline device you can use to configure policies and can subsequently be used to maintain AppLocker policies.
segment.target: An AppLocker reference device is a baseline device you can use to configure policies and can subsequently be used to maintain AppLocker policies.

segment.source: For the procedure to configure a reference device, see Configure the AppLocker reference device.
segment.target: For the procedure to configure a reference device, see Configure the AppLocker reference device.

segment.source: An AppLocker reference device that is used to create and maintain AppLocker policies should contain the corresponding apps for each organizational unit (OU) to mimic your production environment.
segment.target: An AppLocker reference device that is used to create and maintain AppLocker policies should contain the corresponding apps for each organizational unit (OU) to mimic your production environment.

segment.source: Important: The reference device must be running one of the supported editions of Windows.
segment.target: Important: The reference device must be running one of the supported editions of Windows.

segment.source: For information about operating system requirements for AppLocker, see Requirements to use AppLocker.
segment.target: For information about operating system requirements for AppLocker, see Requirements to use AppLocker.

segment.source: You can perform AppLocker policy testing on the reference device by using the Audit only enforcement setting or Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: You can perform AppLocker policy testing on the reference device by using the Audit only enforcement setting or Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: You can also use the reference device as part of a testing configuration that includes policies that are created by using Software Restriction Policies.
segment.target: You can also use the reference device as part of a testing configuration that includes policies that are created by using Software Restriction Policies.

segment.source: Step 1: Automatically generate rules on the reference device
segment.target: Step 1: Automatically generate rules on the reference device

segment.source: With AppLocker, you can automatically generate rules for all files within a folder.
segment.target: With AppLocker, you can automatically generate rules for all files within a folder.

segment.source: AppLocker scans the specified folder and creates the condition types that you choose for each file in that folder.
segment.target: AppLocker scans the specified folder and creates the condition types that you choose for each file in that folder.

segment.source: For the procedure to do this, see Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard.
segment.target: For the procedure to do this, see Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard.

segment.source: Note: If you run this wizard to create your first rules for a Group Policy Object (GPO), after you complete the wizard, you will be prompted to create the default rules, which allow critical system files to run.
segment.target: Note: If you run this wizard to create your first rules for a Group Policy Object (GPO), after you complete the wizard, you will be prompted to create the default rules, which allow critical system files to run.

segment.source: You can edit the default rules at any time.
segment.target: You can edit the default rules at any time.

segment.source: If your organization has decided to edit the default rules or create custom rules to allow the Windows system files to run, ensure that you delete the default rules after you replace them with your custom rules.
segment.target: If your organization has decided to edit the default rules or create custom rules to allow the Windows system files to run, ensure that you delete the default rules after you replace them with your custom rules.

segment.source: Step 2: Create the default rules on the reference device
segment.target: Step 2: Create the default rules on the reference device

segment.source: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection.
segment.target: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection.

segment.source: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed in an AppLocker rule collection.
segment.target: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed in an AppLocker rule collection.

segment.source: You must run the default rules for each rule collection.
segment.target: You must run the default rules for each rule collection.

segment.source: For info about default rules and considerations for using them, see Understanding AppLocker default rules.
segment.target: For info about default rules and considerations for using them, see Understanding AppLocker default rules.

segment.source: For the procedure to create default rules, see Create AppLocker default rules.
segment.target: For the procedure to create default rules, see Create AppLocker default rules.

segment.source: Important: You can use the default rules as a template when you create your own rules.
segment.target: Important: You can use the default rules as a template when you create your own rules.

segment.source: This allows files within the Windows directory to run.
segment.target: This allows files within the Windows directory to run.

segment.source: However, these rules are only meant to function as a starter policy when you are first testing AppLocker rules.
segment.target: However, these rules are only meant to function as a starter policy when you are first testing AppLocker rules.

segment.source: Step 3: Modify rules and the rule collection on the reference device
segment.target: Step 3: Modify rules and the rule collection on the reference device

segment.source: If AppLocker policies are currently running in your production environment, export the policies from the corresponding GPOs and save them to the reference device.
segment.target: If AppLocker policies are currently running in your production environment, export the policies from the corresponding GPOs and save them to the reference device.

segment.source: For the procedure to do this, see Export an AppLocker policy from a GPO.
segment.target: For the procedure to do this, see Export an AppLocker policy from a GPO.

segment.source: If no AppLocker policies have been deployed, create the rules and develop the policies by using the following procedures:
segment.target: If no AppLocker policies have been deployed, create the rules and develop the policies by using the following procedures:

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a publisher condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a publisher condition

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a path condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a path condition

segment.source: Edit AppLocker rules
segment.target: Edit AppLocker rules

segment.source: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule
segment.target: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule

segment.source: Delete an AppLocker rule
segment.target: Delete an AppLocker rule

segment.source: Enable the DLL rule collection
segment.target: Enable the DLL rule collection

segment.source: Enforce AppLocker rules
segment.target: Enforce AppLocker rules

segment.source: Step 4: Test and update AppLocker policy on the reference device
segment.target: Step 4: Test and update AppLocker policy on the reference device

segment.source: You should test each set of rules to ensure that they perform as intended.
segment.target: You should test each set of rules to ensure that they perform as intended.

segment.source: The Test-AppLockerPolicy Windows PowerShell cmdlet can be used to determine whether any of the rules in your rule collection will be blocked on your reference device.
segment.target: The Test-AppLockerPolicy Windows PowerShell cmdlet can be used to determine whether any of the rules in your rule collection will be blocked on your reference device.

segment.source: Perform the steps on each reference device that you used to define the AppLocker policy.
segment.target: Perform the steps on each reference device that you used to define the AppLocker policy.

segment.source: Ensure that the reference device is joined to the domain and that it is receiving the AppLocker policy from the appropriate GPO.
segment.target: Ensure that the reference device is joined to the domain and that it is receiving the AppLocker policy from the appropriate GPO.

segment.source: Because AppLocker rules are inherited from linked GPOs, you should deploy all of the rules to simultaneously test all of your test GPOs.
segment.target: Because AppLocker rules are inherited from linked GPOs, you should deploy all of the rules to simultaneously test all of your test GPOs.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to complete this step:
segment.target: Use the following procedures to complete this step:

segment.source: Test an AppLocker Policy with Test-AppLockerPolicy
segment.target: Test an AppLocker Policy with Test-AppLockerPolicy

segment.source: Discover the Effect of an AppLocker Policy
segment.target: Discover the Effect of an AppLocker Policy

segment.source: Caution: If you have set the enforcement setting on the rule collection to Enforce rules or you have not configured the rule collection, the policy will be implemented when the GPO is updated in the next step.
segment.target: Caution: If you have set the enforcement setting on the rule collection to Enforce rules or you have not configured the rule collection, the policy will be implemented when the GPO is updated in the next step.

segment.source: If you have set the enforcement setting on the rule collection to Audit only, application access events are written to the AppLocker log, and the policy will not take effect.
segment.target: If you have set the enforcement setting on the rule collection to Audit only, application access events are written to the AppLocker log, and the policy will not take effect.

segment.source: Step 5: Export and import the policy into production
segment.target: Step 5: Export and import the policy into production

segment.source: When the AppLocker policy has been tested successfully, it can be imported into the GPO (or imported into individual computers that are not managed by Group Policy) and checked for its intended effectiveness.
segment.target: When the AppLocker policy has been tested successfully, it can be imported into the GPO (or imported into individual computers that are not managed by Group Policy) and checked for its intended effectiveness.

segment.source: To do this, perform the following procedures:
segment.target: To do this, perform the following procedures:

segment.source: Export an AppLocker policy to an XML file
segment.target: Export an AppLocker policy to an XML file

segment.source: Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO or
segment.target: Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO or

segment.source: Discover the Effect of an AppLocker Policy
segment.target: Discover the Effect of an AppLocker Policy

segment.source: If the AppLocker policy enforcement setting is Audit only and you are satisfied that the policy is fulfilling your intent, you can change it to Enforce rules.
segment.target: If the AppLocker policy enforcement setting is Audit only and you are satisfied that the policy is fulfilling your intent, you can change it to Enforce rules.

segment.source: For info about how to change the enforcement setting, see Configure an AppLocker policy for enforce rules.
segment.target: For info about how to change the enforcement setting, see Configure an AppLocker policy for enforce rules.

segment.source: Step 6: Monitor the effect of the policy in production
segment.target: Step 6: Monitor the effect of the policy in production

segment.source: If additional refinements or updates are necessary after a policy is deployed, use the appropriate following procedures to monitor and update the policy:
segment.target: If additional refinements or updates are necessary after a policy is deployed, use the appropriate following procedures to monitor and update the policy:

segment.source: Monitor app usage with AppLocker
segment.target: Monitor app usage with AppLocker

segment.target: Edit an AppLocker policy

segment.target: Refresh an AppLocker policy
